headline: CNN News Central
subHeadline: Officials Give Update After Driver Plows Into TX Shelter, Killing Eight; Closing Arguments In Battery & Defamation Trial Against Trump; Royal Family Volunteers After Weekend Of Celebrating King Charles Crowning. Aired 11:30a-12p ET

utterances.speaker: JEFF ZELENY, CNN CHIEF NATIONAL AFFAIRS CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Have if it's going to be a long hot one, which many of his advisers believe it will. Largely because of these two issues.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: It's a great point, Jeff. Big week ahead. Thanks so much for being with us, Jeff Zeleny. Sara?

utterances.speaker: KATE BOLDUAN, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Welcome back to CNN NEWS CENTRAL. Right now, we are awaiting an update from police in Texas on their ongoing investigation into the deadly crash that killed eight people in Brownsville. CNN has obtained an exclusive video showing what happened after that crash.Bystanders trying to restrain the man suspected of driving an SUV into a group of people standing by. This press conference is beginning now. Let's listen in together. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Greg Mendez and several commissioners here. Chiefs Sauceda will be up here and make a brief statement. And he'll take a couple of questions. Right now, we're going to go ahead and escort the man. And just give us one minute.

utterances.speaker: FELIX SAUCEDA, POLICE CHIEF, BROWNSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT
utterances.sentences: Good morning.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can you state your name, spell it, and then your title, chief?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Well, I'll get that spelling to you guys. OK.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Any questions?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are they all from Venezuela?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: From what we know, several we.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Was he intoxicated, Chief?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: We are waiting on formal toxicology reports.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Is there a motive that you can talk about?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: None at this point.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Several other witnesses had said that he was cursing at them and saying that they were invaders.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: We have nothing to validate that at this point.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Someone from this side.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, the city of Brownsville has a lot of migrants walking around sidewalks, and streets right now. What's the city doing to keep them in safe places like the city of McAllen (INAUDIBLE) many years?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: So, we have a process in play for that. But this press conference is for the tragedy that we are still investigating at this point.

utterances.speaker: NICK VALENCIA, CNN CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Chief, Nick Valencia with CNN. How were you able to rule out that this was not intentional? It sounds like you're saying he lost control.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: We have not ruled that out, sir. It is an ongoing investigation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Has he been caught?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Not at this point, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, a few questions just quickly.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Any additional charges or can you talk about how you would get there?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: So, it is an ongoing investigation. And yes, absolutely, charges can change and charges can be added.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: But he was arraigned today for reckless driving.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: That is correct. Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Can I just quickly ask about the victims? Can you talk about the process of IDieng those and have you identified the nationalities beyond just Venezuela, are all of them migrants, and what has the process been like reaching out to family?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: So, it has been a very tiresome process, but one that we are deeply committed to doing and accomplishing. We are working with the Venezuelan government right now. And we have also reached out to other embassies.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Go ahead, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Where's he being kept right now? And is he in any type of special cell or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Here in our facility so no, no special cell.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Sorry.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Yes, ma'am.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE) places where migrants are being processed in this city.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Once again, this conference is about the tragedy that we continue to investigate.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We have two more questions, please. Sir, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Chief, two questions.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Yes, sir. Yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: It's a question to follow up.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: The extent of the injury, sir, if you can, you know, let us know. Some of the videos in ISOC person, you know that there were missing limbs so on and so forth. That's number one. And the follow-up is how can people help you? If they have videos, how -- what did -- what does the police department need? SAUCEDA

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Last question -- last question. (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes, more about the victims, are they all men, and about Mr. (INAUDIBLE) himself too. He seems sober and what a police officers' encountered when he was there.

utterances.speaker: SAUCEDA
utterances.sentences: So, at this point, I can confirm that they were all males that we know of. And beyond that, we have to wait for official reports.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you all so much for being here. We have the list of charges right there. That mugshot for you all to take pictures of. I have a contact list there in the back for everybody that is not familiar with us to leave your name and e-mail that we can email you any updates further on with this case.As far as that, please send me an e-mail with all your questions from this point from right now, and I will answer them accordingly. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: JENNIFER RODGERS, CNN LEGAL ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Well, it means either one or the other, right? She has these two causes of action. So, they believe her on one or the other if they come back in her favor. And they'll come back also with the damages amount too. So, we're looking for that, too.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: That seems like it could be a very big deal if the jury side with E. Jean Carol.

utterances.speaker: RODGERS
utterances.sentences: It is. It is, of course. Because she says that he raped her. He denies it. I mean, for them to come back in her favor means that they don't believe him, and that he's a rapist effectively if I find that my account.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Let me ask you about when it comes to the fact that he did not show up to this trial. You know, a lot of times defendants don't take the stand. But this is a civil case, so it could be quite different. How much damage did that potentially do to his case?

utterances.speaker: RODGERS
utterances.sentences: A lot, I think. I mean, first of all, it shows that he's not really putting in the time. He doesn't care enough about it to show up.But his testimony that we saw in the deposition released on Friday was really harmful to him. I mean, his demeanor was terrible. He was arrogant and insensitive and insulting. He doubled down on the Access Hollywood tape effectively saying I'm a star. Stars can assault women, and maybe that's OK. So, I think it was really damaging to him for him to not show up on top of that, and at least try to spin it all another way, doesn't really give the jury anything to hold on to if they want to find for him.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: And I want to show that now. This is of that deposition you were talking about. And here he is, in his own words.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, FORMER PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES
utterances.sentences: The only difference between me and other people is I'm honest. She's not my type. I would not, under any circumstances have any interest in you.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: He goes on to talk about that moment where he was talking about grabbing women in the private parts and saying that that was sort of just a normal everyday thing that you did as a celebrity. So, like you said, if the jury looks at that -- and also he says that she's not my type. But then he also confused her with his wife, Marla Maples, I think at one point, there's a lot that the jury has been looking at. And there are people who are also taking the stand beside E. Jean Carroll, correct?

utterances.speaker: RODGERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, she had two friends of hers who she told at the time back in the 90s, that this had happened to her. Their testimony was very powerful. And other witnesses too.A psychologist who talked about how rape victims process and why not screaming is not surprising, you know, those sorts of things damage a person who talked about the damage to her career and put it in monetary terms. So, she has a lot of evidence. He doesn't have much. We'll see what the jury does.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: We'll see what the jury does. Thank you so much, Jennifer Rodgers, appreciate you coming on and being here.

utterances.speaker: RODGERS
utterances.sentences: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: Yes. Kate.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: So, after a whirlwind weekend celebrating the coronation of King Charles, royal family members were out volunteering at community events this morning. That includes five-year-old Prince Louis, the youngest child of the Prince and Princess of Wales who took part in his first Royal Engagement. I think his father's having more fun by the way in that picture than he is.CNN's Nada Bashir is in London for us. It was an exciting morning for them, Nada. NADA BASHIR, CNN INTERNATIONAL REPORTER (on camera): Yes, it absolutely was. The first world engagement for Prince Louis. This follows a whirlwind weekend essentially. This was a moment of history with some thousands of people taking to the streets in London across the weekend not only to of course witness the coronation on Saturday, but we also saw a concert in Windsor, of course, the beloved home of Queen Elizabeth -- the late Queen Elizabeth II. What we did see was Prince William shear a very special message marking the coronation dedicated of course to his father, the new monarch. Take a listen. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: PRINCE WILLIAM, PRINCE OF WALES
utterances.sentences: My father's first words on entering Westminster Abbey yesterday, were a pledge of service. It was a pledge to continue to serve. Because for over 50 years, in every corner of the UK across the Commonwealth and around the world, he has dedicated himself to serve others. Pa, we are all so proud of you.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: Nada Bashir, thank you very much for that report. Viewership down, I wonder if it was all related to King Charles' dancing.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I wonder if they saw him dancing and turn the channel.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: No. you tune in --

utterances.speaker: SIDNER
utterances.sentences: That's not what happened.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Nada Bashir, thank you very much for that report. Viewership down, I wondered if it was all related to King Charles' dancing. I wondered if they saw him dancing and turned the channel immediately.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: KATE BOLDUAN, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: You lean into that. You tune in when you see a king dance like that.

utterances.speaker: BERMAN
utterances.sentences: I mean, you can't be (Inaudible) as you can't be impeached for that kind of dancing.

utterances.speaker: BOLDUAN
utterances.sentences: But you can be shamed by John Berman apparently.

utterances.speaker: SARA SIDNER, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: It happens. King Berman, he is angling.
